intro: Torrubia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited torrubia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dark green, leathery leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late spring. Its fruit is a distinctive, fleshy capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Torrubia macrocarpa thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and heathlands.
